frameDefinitions: A former Member of a Group ceases to be a member as a result of the action of an Authority within the Group.
A Mother and Father produce a Child or an Egg. 'Betty bore Gerry three intelligent daughters.'
An Entity shares a name with its Namesake.
This frame contains words that denote Kinship relations.
This frame concerns entities conventionally being referred to by particular names.
This  frame contains words that talk about how Speakers name Entities.
frameExamples: The priest <t>excommunicated</t> Henry from the church.
They drove through an area <t>nicknamed</t> Sniper's Alley
listRoleDefinitions: The person who used to belong to a <fen>Group</fen>.
A set of people standing in a semi-permanent relationship together.
An empowered subset of the <fen>Group</fen> which decides to expel its former <fen>Member</fen>.
The time when the <fen>Member</fen> is excluded.
The Place where the <fen>Member</fen> is excluded.
<fen>Mother</fen> is the female creature that produces the <fen>Child</fen>.
<fen>Child</fen> identifies the new self-motile creature produced from the <fen>Mother</fen> and <fen>Father</fen>.
<fen>Father</fen> is the male creature that copulates with the <fen>Mother</fen>, thus  leading to the birth of the <fen>Child</fen>.
<fen>Egg</fen> is an immobile object containing an organism that may hatch as a mobile, infant organism.
The <fen>Mother</fen> and <fen>Father</fen> expressed together.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the event occurs.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the event occurs.
The <fen>Entity</fen> about whom it is asserted that they share a name with a <fen>Namesake</fen>.
The person or thing that has the same name as the <fen>Entity</fen>.
The person who fills the role named by the Kinship term with respect to the <fen>Ego</fen>.
The person from whose perspective the Kinship relationship is defined.
The combination of <fen>Alter</fen> and <fen>Ego</fen> together.
<fen>Name</fen> identifies the linguistic expression used to refer to Entities.
The <fen>Entity</fen> is the person the speaker intends to refer to by using a particular name.
The entity that Speakers refer to by using the Name.
The linguistic expression by which Speakers refer to the Entity.
The person who uses the linguistic expression (Name) to refer to the Referent.
When the event occurs.
Where the event takes place.
listRoleExamples: I 'm afraid that <fex>I</fex> was expelled from the Society after they found I endorsed him.
Giles bemoaned his expulsion <fex>from the Future Farmers of America</fex>
Female clownfish lay <fex>their eggs</fex> around sea anemones
<fex>We</fex> are going to be having twins!
Homer's mythical enchantress was a weaver, and so is <fex>her</fex> namesake

the Pontifical Council for the Family
the Offices of the Congregation for the Doctrine of the Faith
the United Nations Convention on the Rights of the Child
the Ordinary Session of this Congregation
the law” (Congregation for the Doctrine of the Faith
Letter on the pastoral care of homosexual persons
